drugs.name: Warfarin
drugs.common_uses: Prevention of blood clots in atrial fibrillation, deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism
drugs.interactions_profile: High risk with antiplatelet agents, NSAIDs, and drugs affecting CYP2C9

drugs.name: Atorvastatin
drugs.interactions_profile: CYP3A4 substrate, interactions with macrolides, azole antifungals

drugs.name: Lisinopril
drugs.interactions_profile: Potassium-sparing effects, interactions with NSAIDs, lithium

drugs.name: Metformin
drugs.interactions_profile: Low interaction potential, mainly renal elimination

drugs.name: Ibuprofen
drugs.interactions_profile: High interaction potential with anticoagulants, ACE inhibitors, diuretics

drugs.name: Fluoxetine
drugs.common_uses: Depression, anxiety disorders, OCD, bulimia nervosa
drugs.interactions_profile: CYP2D6 inhibitor, serotonergic interactions, bleeding risk with anticoagulants

interactions.mechanism: Additive anticoagulant effects and platelet inhibition
interactions.description: Concurrent use significantly increases bleeding risk due to warfarin's anticoagulant effects and ibuprofen's antiplatelet activity and GI irritation.
interactions.clinical_evidence: Multiple case reports and studies demonstrate 2-3 fold increase in bleeding risk
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. Use acetaminophen for pain relief instead.
interactions.monitoring: If unavoidable, monitor INR daily and watch for bleeding signs

interactions.mechanism: CYP2C9 enzyme competition and protein binding displacement
interactions.description: Atorvastatin may enhance warfarin's anticoagulant effect through hepatic enzyme interactions.
interactions.clinical_evidence: Small studies show modest INR increases in some patients
interactions.recommendation: Monitor INR more frequently when starting/stopping atorvastatin
interactions.monitoring: Check INR within 1-2 weeks of dose changes

interactions.description: NSAIDs reduce prostaglandin synthesis, potentially decreasing ACE inhibitor effectiveness and worsening kidney function.
interactions.clinical_evidence: Studies show reduced antihypertensive effect and increased serum creatinine
interactions.recommendation: Monitor blood pressure and kidney function closely
interactions.monitoring: Check serum creatinine and potassium within 1 week

interactions.mechanism: Additive effects on platelet function and bleeding risk
interactions.description: SSRIs affect platelet serotonin, and combined with NSAID's antiplatelet effects, increase bleeding risk.
interactions.clinical_evidence: Epidemiological studies show increased GI and other bleeding events
interactions.recommendation: Consider gastroprotective therapy and monitor for bleeding
interactions.monitoring: Watch for signs of bleeding, especially GI symptoms

interactions.mechanism: Potential additive effects on kidney function
interactions.description: Both drugs are eliminated by kidneys; ACE inhibitors may slightly affect kidney function.
interactions.clinical_evidence: Generally safe combination with minimal interaction risk
interactions.recommendation: Routine monitoring of kidney function as with individual drugs

interactions.mechanism: Minimal pharmacokinetic interaction via CYP enzymes
interactions.description: Low risk interaction between statin and SSRI with different primary metabolism pathways.
interactions.clinical_evidence: No significant clinical interactions reported in literature
interactions.recommendation: Continue both medications with routine monitoring
interactions.monitoring: Standard monitoring for liver function (statin) and mood (SSRI)

severe.action: Avoid combination or use extreme caution with intensive monitoring

moderate.description: Significant interaction requiring monitoring and possible dose adjustment
moderate.action: Monitor closely and adjust therapy as needed

mild.description: Minor interaction with minimal clinical significance
